title: Billy Vunipola fit for England's crunch quarter-final with Australia to give World Cup hopes a massive boost
text:
England have been handed a major boost ahead of their World Cup quarter-final against Australia with the news that Billy Vunipola has come through the squad’s final major training session on Wednesday in good shape and is fit to start in the match in Oita on Saturday.

Vunipola’s chances of being fit for the match had been rated as “highly-likely” on Tuesday by England’s defence coach John Mitchell as the Saracens forward continued his rehabilitation from an ankle injury that he sustained during the first half of the victory against Los Pumas in Tokyo Stadium.

Vunipola, however, had...
description: England have been handed a major boost ahead of their World Cup quarter-final against Australia with the news that Billy Vunipola has come through the squad’s final major training session on Wednesday in good shape and is fit to start in the match in Oita on Saturday.
